{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.04929v1", "title": "Nordhaus-Gaddum-type theorems for maximum average degree", "summary": "A $k$-decomposition $(G_1,\dots,G_k)$ of a graph $G$ is a partition of its
edge set into $k$ spanning subgraphs $G_1,\dots,G_k$. The classical theorem of
Nordhaus and Gaddum bounds $\chi(G_1) + \chi(G_2)$ and $\chi(G_1) \chi(G_2)$
over all 2-decompositions of $K_n$.
  For a graph parameter $p$, let $p(k,G) = \max \{ \sum_{i=1}^k p(Gi) \}$,
taken over all $k$-decompositions of graph $G$. In this paper we consider
$M(k,K_n) = M(k,n) = \max \{ \sum_{i=1}^k \mathrm{Mad}(G_i) \}$, taken over all
$k$-decompositions of the complete graph $K_n$, where $\mathrm{Mad}(G)$ denotes
the maximum average degree of $G$, $\mathrm{Mad}(G) = \max \{ 2e(H)/|H| : H
\subseteq G \} = \max \{d(H) : H \subseteq G \}$.
  Among the many results obtained in this paper we mention the following
selected ones.
  (1) $M(k, n) < \sqrt{k} n$, and $\lim_{k\to\infty} ( \liminf_{n\to\infty}
\frac{M(k,n)}{\sqrt{k}\,n} ) = 1$.
  (2) Exact determination of $M(2,n)$.
  (3) Exact determination of $M(k,n)$ when $k = \binom{n}{2} - t$, $0 \leq
t\leq (n-1)^2/3$.
  Applications of these bounds to other parameters considered before in the
literature are given.", "main_category": "math.CO", "categories": "math.CO", "published": "2025-05-08T04:06:05Z"}
